article_node.title: Asia Markets Stabilise as Fed Comments, Jobs Data Point to Cuts
article_node.summary: Asian stocks edged higher on early trading, buoyed by dovish Fed remarks and weaker U.S. job openings data that bolster expectations of rate cuts. Chinese shares fell for a third day amid reports of forthcoming cooling measures by regulators. While a bond selloff eased, long‑dated borrowing costs stayed near multi‑year highs and the dollar slipped modestly against the yen, with the DXY unchanged.
